intro: Elynanthus capitatus, commonly known as the yellow globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its seed pods are cylindrical and contain several small, bean-like seeds. Elynanthus capitatus plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a food source for various wildlife.
